intro: Silene royenii, commonly known as the Royal catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its striking pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Silene royenii has small, hairy leaves and produces capsules that contain numerous seeds. It is often found in regions with limited moisture, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments.
